headline: Safari specialists add significant value for first-timers
summary: For first-time safari travelers, booking through a specialized agent provides considerable benefits: destination expertise, camp relationships, crisis support, and itinerary optimization. While direct booking saves 10-15% on commission, the hidden complexity of safari logistics often leads to suboptimal choices. The value proposition shifts after 2-3 safaris when travelers understand the ecosystem.

assumptions.text: First-time safari travelers face a steep learning curve on camps, routes, and timing.
Good agents have camp relationships that secure better availability and perks.
Agent support during flight cancellations or health issues is valuable in remote areas.

losses: May push preferred partners over best fit

change_conditions: If you've done 3+ safaris and know the camps, direct booking saves money.
If budget is severely constrained, direct booking with thorough research may work.
If you have a strong existing relationship with a camp, book direct.
If traveling in peak season, agent relationships help secure availability.
